intro: Stegolepis jauaensis, commonly known as the Jauaensis mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Viscaraceae and typically grows on the branches of host trees such as those in the genus Hirtella. The plant has small, oval-shaped leaves and produces white or yellowish flowers that are often clustered together. Its fruits are small berries that contain seeds dispersed by birds. Due to its parasitic nature, it can significantly affect the health of its host trees if left unchecked.
